text.text: How do I access the All Adjustment Details report?

text: To run the All Adjustment Details report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click All Adjustment Details. 3. Accounting Period Start Date: Click this field to select a start date for the report. 4. Profit Centers: Click this field to select one or more profit centers.

text.text: What information does the All Adjustment Details report display?

text: The All Adjustment Details report shows adjustments for claims in that accounting period. The report contains the following columns of information: Accounting period, Deposit date, HCPCS code, adjustment amount, Adjustment type, charge amount, Adjustment code(s), Payer, Claim adjustment amount, Policy, Claim charge amount, Posted by and posted date, Claim number, Profit center, Date of service, Transaction number.

text.text: What options do I have for selecting the accounting period in the All Adjustment Details report?

text: You can select the accounting period start date and then your profit center to see charges by profit center. You can also select inactive profit center zones and HCPCS.

text.text: Can I choose specific profit centers to include in the All Adjustment Details report?

text: Yes, you can choose specific profit centers to include in the All Adjustment Details report.

text.text: How can I display inactive profit center zones in the All Adjustment Details report?

text: To display inactive profit center zones in the All Adjustment Details report, you can select the "Display Inactive Zones" option and click "True".

text.text: Is there an option to include HCPCS in the All Adjustment Details report?

text: Yes, you can select the "Display HCPCS" option and click "True" to include HCPCS in the All Adjustment Details report.

text.text: How do I view the All Adjustment Details report once I've selected my preferences?

text: To run the All Adjustment Details report, you can click "View Report". The report contains the following columns of information: Accounting period, Deposit date, HCPCS code, adjustment amount, Adjustment type, charge amount, Adjustment code(s), Payer, Claim adjustment amount, Policy, Claim charge amount, Posted by and posted date, Claim number, Profit center, Date of service, Transaction number.

text.text: What columns of information are included in the All Adjustment Details report?

text: The All Adjustment Details report contains the following columns of information: Accounting period, Deposit date, HCPCS code, adjustment amount, Adjustment type, charge amount, Adjustment code(s), Payer, Claim adjustment amount, Policy, Claim charge amount, Posted by and posted date, Claim number, Profit center, Date of service, Transaction number.

text.text: What is the recommended method for digesting the information in the All Adjustment Details report?

text: One of the best way to digest the information in the report is to export the report to a .csv file. From there you can view / manage the data. If you are not good with Excel, we have some great videos that will get you started.

text.text: How can I export the All Adjustment Details report for further analysis?

text: To export the All Adjustment Details report, you can click "View Report". The report contains the following columns of information: Accounting period, Deposit date, HCPCS code, adjustment amount, Adjustment type, charge amount, Adjustment code(s), Payer, Claim adjustment amount, Policy, Claim charge amount, Posted by and posted date, Claim number, Profit center, Date of service, Transaction number.

text.text: What is the purpose of the Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report?

text: The Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report is used to view contractual allowances, denials, and payment adjustments posted to claims by deposit date. The report now contains information on payment adjustments and contractual allowances.

text.text: How has the Denials report changed to become the Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report?

text: The Denials report has a new name and more information. Hereâ€™s how it changed: New name: We renamed the Denials report to "Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes" to reflect its new content. New description: The report description changed to "View contractual allowances, denials, and payment adjustments posted to claims by deposit date". Additional content: The report now contains information on payment adjustments and contractual allowances.

text.text: What additional information does the Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report contain?

text: The Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report contains information on payment adjustments and contractual allowances.

text.text: How do I access the Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report?

text: To run the report, on the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. Scroll down the list and click Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes.

text.text: What date range options are available for the Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report?

text: You can select a starting and ending date for the report.

text.text: What types of denial or adjustment types can I choose from in the report?

text: You can choose from Contractual Allowances, Denials, and Payment Adjustments.

text.text: How can the Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report help in identifying problems?

text: The report can be run daily to spot problems and identify issues that you could have avoided. You can look for reoccurring mistakes by billers and problems with specific payers.

text.text: What should I look for when analyzing the Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report?

text: You should look for areas that have a high incidence of denials where improvements can be made to your billing process.

text.text: What is the significance of the "Biller" column in the report?

text: The biller listed in the "Biller" column coded and submitted the claim. This information can be used to train billers to avoid those "avoidable denials".

text.text: Why is it important to run the Denials and Adjustment Reason Codes report regularly?

text: The report can be run daily to spot problems and identify issues that you could have avoided. You can look for reoccurring mistakes by billers and problems with specific payers. You should look for areas that have a high incidence of denials where improvements can be made to your billing process.

text.text: How to run the adjustment report?

text: To run the adjustment report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click All adjustment details. 3. Accounting Period Start Date: Click this field to select a start date for the report. 4. Profit Centers: Click this field to select one or more profit centers.
